thread.title: US customs computer system outage sends international air hubs into chaos (PHOTOS)
thread.title_full: US customs computer system outage sends international air hubs into chaos (PHOTOS)

author: RT
title: US customs computer system outage sends international air hubs into chaos (PHOTOS)
text:
Stranded travelers took to social media to vent their frustration. Passengers reported delays ranging from 30 minutes to several hours. Customs line at Atlanta airport snaking around multiple wings of building. Supposedly homeland security system down pic.twitter.com/EtSMhWHQgV — Jordana Merran (@JordanaMerran) January 3, 2017 
JFK International in New York, LAX in Los Angeles, Miami, Fort Lauderdale, Atlanta and Washington Dulles International Airports have been affected by the outage. @cnn @tsa @nbc @FoxNews please help us! Customs in #miami is shut down. Panic attacks. Shoving. Chaos. Fire hazard pic.twitter.com/0oezNzs4ge — Michelle S. (@michelle63126) January 3, 2017 
Systems have reportedly been coming back online, but it is not yet known what caused it. A spokesperson for the US Custom and Border Protection in Washington D.C. said an outage with their computer system has been resolved, Fox reported. Customs officers processed international travelers using “alternative procedures” until the system came back online. @CustomsBorder system up & running. Will take time for passengers to be processed. Thx 4 UR patience. Many airports affected 2nite.
